source: 211 Virginia, Virginia Department of Veterans Services, and partner organizations

resources.name: 211 Virginia
resources.description: Free, confidential 24/7 service connecting residents with community resources including housing, food, healthcare, employment, mental health, legal services, and veteran-specific support

resources.name: Virginia Department of Veterans Services
resources.description: State agency serving nearly 700,000 veterans in Virginia, providing access to benefits, services, and a network of veteran-focused organizations

resources.name: Virginia Veteran & Family Support Program (VVFS)
resources.description: Provides behavioral health, peer mentoring, family support, and coordinates access to financial services, transportation, housing, employment, and education assistance for veterans and their families

resources.name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) - Virginia Department
resources.description: Membership organization providing veteran services, advocacy, and community support with multiple chapters across Virginia

resources.name: DAV Chapter #20 (Virginia Beach)
resources.phone: For details, contact main DAV line at 1-877-426-2838
resources.description: Local DAV chapter providing veteran support and community resources, meets 3rd Tuesday of month at 7:00 PM

resources.name: VFW Department of Virginia
resources.description: Veterans of Foreign Wars state headquarters coordinating 40+ posts across Virginia, providing veteran support and community services

resources.name: VFW Post 3103 (Fredericksburg)
resources.description: Local VFW post providing community support and veteran services

resources.name: VFW Post 1264 (Roanoke)
resources.description: Local VFW post serving veterans in the Roanoke area

resources.name: American Legion Department of Virginia
resources.description: State headquarters for American Legion with 208 posts across 17 districts serving over 39,500 members, providing veteran community support and services

resources.name: American Legion Post 3 (Roanoke)
resources.description: Local American Legion post providing veteran support and community services

resources.name: American Legion Post 16 (Lynchburg)
resources.description: Local American Legion post serving the Lynchburg area

resources.name: American Legion Post 72 (Warrenton)
resources.description: Local American Legion post serving northern Virginia

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: Free, confidential 24/7 service providing immediate assistance and connection to VA services for homeless or at-risk veterans

resources.name: LINK of Hampton Roads - Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF)
resources.phone: Contact through LINK of Hampton Roads
resources.description: Program dedicated to enhancing housing stability and preventing homelessness for low-income veteran families in the Virginia Peninsula

resources.name: Tap Into Hope - Supportive Services for Veteran Families (Roanoke)
resources.description: Program providing housing stability assistance and support to help veterans find new homes or keep current housing

resources.name: Armed Services YMCA (ASYMCA) - Virginia Beach Patriots Pantry
resources.description: Provides emergency food assistance and baby supplies to military families and veterans, serves Ft. Eustis and Ft. Langley every third Thursday

resources.name: Virginia Peninsula Foodbank
resources.description: Food bank serving individuals, families, children, seniors and veterans in Newport News, Hampton, Williamsburg, James City County, Gloucester, Mathews, York, Poquoson and Surry

resources.name: Feed More (Richmond)
resources.description: Major food bank serving central Virginia with resources for veterans and families in need

resources.name: Feeding Southwest Virginia
resources.description: Food bank serving southwest Virginia with food assistance programs for veterans and families

resources.name: Fredericksburg Regional Food Bank
resources.description: Food bank serving central Virginia with emergency food assistance for veterans

resources.name: Federation of Virginia Food Banks
resources.description: Network of food banks throughout Virginia with searchable directory for locating food banks and pantries by location

resources.name: Lewis B. Puller, Jr. Veterans Benefits Clinic - William & Mary Law School
resources.description: Free legal clinic providing assistance with disability compensation claims and veteran benefits

resources.name: Mason Veterans and Servicemembers Legal Clinic - George Mason University Law School
resources.description: Free legal services for service members and veterans in litigation and non-litigation matters
resources.website: Contact through George Mason University Law School
resources.source_url: Contact through George Mason University Law School

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: Confidential mental health crisis support for veterans and their families available 24/7

resources.name: Virginia Values Veterans (V3) Program
resources.description: Employment program connecting veterans to veteran-ready employers with resume review, career coaching, mentorship, and training opportunities

resources.name: Virginia Transition Assistance Program (VTAP)
resources.description: Career readiness and job placement assistance for transitioning service members and veterans

resources.name: VA Veteran Readiness and Employment (VR&E)
resources.description: Federal program providing job training, education, employment accommodations, resume development, and job seeking skills coaching

resources.name: Operation Homefront - Permanent Homes for Veterans
resources.description: Provides mortgage-free homes to eligible veteran families with dedicated caseworkers and financial counseling support

resources.name: Wounded Warrior Project Resource Center
resources.description: Provides support programs and resources for wounded warriors and their families with a resource center open M-F 9am-9pm ET
